info.title: Health Diagnosis and Treatment API Specifications
info.description: Specifications for messages that support livestock health and disease diagnosis and treatments.

tags.name: ADE-1.2-health
tags.description: Health messages approved by the working group

get.summary: Get the diagnoses for a certain location
get.description:
# Purpose
Provides the animal health diagnoses for a location

200.description: Successful. The response contains the diagnoses for the given location.

post.summary: Add a single new diagnosis event
post.description:
# Purpose  
Allows a client to add a single animal health diagnosis event.

requestBody.description:
The health diagnosis event to create. 
A client MAY fill in the *Id* field with a client-generated UUID and the server MAY use this *Id*.
If the server does not use the client-specified *ID* field it shall issue its own *ID* for the resource.
A client SHALL ensure that the *meta.source* and *meta.sourceId* fields are filled by the client.

200.description: Successful. The response contains a copy of the event, as modifed by the server.

201.description: Created. The Location header contains the URI to the new resource.

Location.description: Contains the URI to the new resource.

202.description: Accepted. The Location header contains a URI that the client can query for processing status.

Location.description: Contains a URI to query creation status.

get.summary: Get the treatments for a certain location
get.description:
# Purpose
Provides the animal health treatments for a location

200.description: Successful. The response contains the treatments for the given location.

post.summary: Add a single new health treatment event
post.description:
# Purpose  
Allows a client to add a single animal health treatment event.

requestBody.description:
The health treatment event to create. 
A client MAY fill in the *ID* field with a client-generated UUID and the server MAY use this *ID*.
If the server does not use the client-specified *ID* field it shall issue its own *ID* for the resource.
A client SHALL ensure that the *meta.source* and *meta.sourceId* fields are filled by the client.

200.description: Successful. The response contains a copy of the event, as modifed by the server.

201.description: Created. The Location header contains the URI to the new resource.

202.description: Accepted. The Location header contains a URI that the client can query for processing status.

get.summary: Get the treatment programs for a certain location
get.description:
# Purpose
Provides the animal health treatment programs for a location

200.description: Successful. The response contains the treatment progams for the given location.

post.summary: Add a single new health treatment programme.
post.description:
# Purpose  
Allows a client to add a single animal health treatment programme.

requestBody.description:
The health treatment programme resource to create. 
A client MAY fill in the *ID* field with a client-generated UUID and the server MAY use this *ID*.
If the server does not use the client-specified *ID* field it shall issue its own *ID* for the resource.
A client SHALL ensure that the *meta.source* and *meta.sourceId* fields are filled by the client.
This applies to all resource *ID* and *meta* objects in the *icarTreatmentProgramEvent*.

200.description: Successful. The response contains a copy of the event, as modifed by the server.

201.description: Created. The Location header contains the URI to the new resource.

202.description: Accepted. The Location header contains a URI that the client can query for processing status.

post.summary: Add a single new diagnosis event
post.description:
# Purpose  
Allows a client to add a collection of animal health diagnosis events.

requestBody.description:
The collection of health diagnosis events to create. 
A client MAY fill in resource *Id*s with a client-generated UUID and the server MAY use these *Id*s.
If the server does not use the client-specified *Id* field it shall issue its own *Id*s for the resources.
A client SHALL ensure that the *meta.source* and *meta.sourceId* fields are filled by the client.

200.description: Successful. The response contains a set of batch results, which may include warnings.

201.description: Created. The Location header contains URI to retrieve a set of batch results, which may include warnings.

Location.description: Contains the URI to the results.

202.description: Accepted. The Location header contains a URI that the client can query for processing status.

Location.description: Contains a URI to query creation status.

default.description: The response contains a set of batch results, which may include errors and warnings.

post.summary: Add a collection of health treatment events
post.description:
# Purpose  
Allows a client to add a collection of animal health treatment events.

requestBody.description:
The collection of health treatment events to create. 
A client MAY fill in resource *Id*s with a client-generated UUID and the server MAY use these *Id*s.
If the server does not use the client-specified *Id* field it shall issue its own *Id*s for the resources.
A client SHALL ensure that the *meta.source* and *meta.sourceId* fields are filled by the client.

200.description: Successful. The response contains a set of batch results, which may include warnings.

201.description: Created. The Location header contains URI to retrieve a set of batch results, which may include warnings.

Location.description: Contains the URI to the results.

202.description: Accepted. The Location header contains a URI that the client can query for processing status.

Location.description: Contains a URI to query creation status.

default.description: The response contains a set of batch results, which may include errors and warnings.

post.summary: Add a collection of animal health treatment program events.
post.description:
# Purpose  
Allows a client to add a collection of animal health treatment program events.

requestBody.description:
The collection of health treatment program events to create. 
A client MAY fill in resource *Id*s with a client-generated UUID and the server MAY use these *Id*s.
If the server does not use the client-specified *Id* field it shall issue its own *Id*s for the resources.
A client SHALL ensure that the *meta.source* and *meta.sourceId* fields are filled by the client.

200.description: Successful. The response contains a set of batch results, which may include warnings.

201.description: Created. The Location header contains URI to retrieve a set of batch results, which may include warnings.

Location.description: Contains the URI to the results.

202.description: Accepted. The Location header contains a URI that the client can query for processing status.

Location.description: Contains a URI to query creation status.

default.description: The response contains a set of batch results, which may include errors and warnings.

location-scheme.name: location-scheme
location-scheme.description: The scheme id for the location identifier.

location-id.name: location-id
location-id.description: The unique identifier for the location.

meta-modified-from.name: meta-modified-from
meta-modified-from.description: The start of the date-time range for the data to get in the request.

meta-modified-to.name: meta-modified-to
meta-modified-to.description: The end of the date-time range for the data to get in the request.

animal-scheme.name: animal-scheme
animal-scheme.description: The scheme id for the animal identifier.

animal-id.name: animal-id
animal-id.description: The unique identifier for the animal.

default.description: An error has occured while handling the request. Check the content of the message for the error details.

schema.description: A default response containing only a list of errors
